text: Kawasaki Heavy Industries & Nippon Sharyo C751B was the third generation rolling stock used on the Singapore MRT system. The trains operated on the East West Line and North South Line. The trains began operation on 28 January 2000. They were built by Kawasaki and Nippon Sharyo. 21 six-carriage trains were built in Kobe, Japan. All C751B trains were removed from service by 30 September 2024, and the train cars were preserved or scrapped by 11 December 2024. each the same builder plates under the train numbers. ==Related pages== *Kawasaki Heavy Industries C151 *Siemens C651 *Kawasaki Heavy Industries & CSR Qingdao Sifang C151A *Kawasaki Heavy Industries & CSR Qingdao Sifang C151B Category:Mass Rapid Transit (Singapore) Category:Rolling stock
title: Kawasaki Heavy Industries & Nippon Sharyo C751B
